duties_responsibilities.duty: Designing, building, testing, and implementing automation/robotics solutions for distribution centers.
Assessing and leading research projects to improve process efficiency and implement innovative manufacturing concepts.
Examining business case and tradeoffs for new distribution concepts, process development, and automation equipment procurement.
Planning robot installation programs, specifying robot capabilities, and preparing cost proposals and efficiency studies.
Reviewing product designs for cost and manufacturing, preparing project justifications, and managing spend.
Soliciting quotations, qualifying suppliers, and selecting equipment vendors, reviewing process equipment progress, and managing delivery schedule.
Implementing automated processes to reduce labor dependency, acting as liaison between Design, Manufacturing, and Distribution.
Piloting and debugging distribution processes for production-based environments and recommending physical changes to support equipment installation.
Serving as the site champion for Newell Brands equipment introduction process and adhering to Newell PEAK procedures.
Providing support to other distribution centers in the network for automation deployment and operation, with travel not to exceed 20% of the time.

education_certification.credential: Bachelor's degree in engineering (electrical, mechanical, manufacturing, or industrial) specializing in robotics/automation. Minimum 5 years of relevant work experience with hands-on experience with robots.
